name: Marriott New York at the Brooklyn Bridge

reviews.text: I started looking for a hotel a couple of weeks before I needed to be in NYC. Big mistake. It took me quite a while to find a balance of price, features & location. I settled here.
reviews.title: Great Location, Mediocre Hotel

reviews.text: Location-wise, this hotel is perfect. Manhattan is 10-15 minutes away by one of 6 different subway lines or you can walk over on the Brooklyn Bridge. It's smack dab in the middle of Brooklyn Hts and you have all kinds of restaurants and shops within walking distance. That part is totally awesome. If you wanted to be in Manhattan but didn't reserve in time, this is the hotel for you.
reviews.title: overpriced

likes.liked: — the water cooler with fruit in the water at the registration desk
likes.disliked: — hair under the sink and under the bed

reviews.text: But I'm also paying $400 a night. Cheaper than a comparable place in Lower Manhattan, but expensive enough that I have expectations. For example, the red and gold decoration that they just remodeled to is hideous. Someone else's breakfast tray sat outside my door for the first day I was hear. And the newspaper delivery in the AM is spotty. The lamp on my desk rattles with every key I hit. And the bed frame rattled every time I switched positions even slightly (I fixed it with a folded over piece of paper).
reviews.title: Great Views from the Marriott

reviews.text: On the plus side, the room is clean and the staff was at least somewhat tolerant when I went back down twice to get a different room (initial room: 4th floor, interior window, final room, 7th floor, exterior window).
reviews.title: Awakened by construction power drilling early Saturday morning

reviews.text: Overall, this hotel is a good compromise. But if you're out here, you really owe it to yourself to explore the neighborhood. You'll find great food and atmosphere just outside the door.
reviews.title: Great family option for visiting NYC

reviews.text: We chose this hotel because we are Marriott platinum elite and since our daughter moved to Brooklyn, thought we would try the most convenient Marriott. Unfortunately, we were extremely disappointed. After having stayed over 75 nights in Marriotts in 2006 and many nights in 2007, we considered the treatment we got at this hotel to be woefully lacking.
reviews.title: Will not go back

reviews.text: We had booked a double bedded room since we had an adult daughter accompanying us but when we got there all they had available was a king bed room without much room to even put in a rollaway if we had to. We are supposed to get a welcome snack but that was nowhere to be found. They put us in the king room with a promise to move us ASAP but after not hearing back for quite awhile finally were able to locate an acceptable room.
reviews.title: Great spot in Brooklyn Heights

likes.disliked: — pool area too far from south building
